page.title: 16RIVER SEVERN
page.content: The{River Severn}is a major feature within this area. At this point it is about{10 metres}wide and having left the{Severn Gorge}it is now in The "Valley" stage. The steep banks are well vegetated with grass and bushes. There are a large number of birds and wild animals. After heavy rain the river is prone to{flooding. In the past, it was much used for cargo but now its main use is for canoeing and{salmon fishing.}The local rambling society regularly walks along the beautiful west bank, where there is a footpath. The attraction of the river (and the flat land) has been an influence on the location of the{caravan site}at Quatford. There are plans to make the river navigable again as far up as Bridgnorth.
